name: Sprint 3 - Critical Automation Fix
goal: Fix Start Automation button failure by updating LinkedIn selectors and restoring core automation functionality

items.title: Start Automation button fails - pagination elements not found
items.description: The Start Automation button does not work properly. When clicked, the automation attempts to start but immediately fails due to missing pagination elements on the LinkedIn search results page. The automation shows 'No name element found in search results' errors and stops with 'No connectable profiles found on this page, stopping automation' message.
acceptanceCriteria: Start Automation button successfully initiates automation process
LinkedIn profile elements are correctly identified and processed
Pagination selectors work properly for page navigation
No 'No name element found' errors occur during normal operation
Automation status correctly changes from 'Inactive' to 'Active'
Core automation functionality is fully restored
All LinkedIn DOM selectors are updated to current page structure
Comprehensive error handling prevents automation failures
User can successfully process LinkedIn profiles through automation
Console errors related to selector failures are eliminated

agenda: Review critical automation bug details and impact
What did you work on yesterday?
What will you work on today?
What went well during critical bug resolution?
How can we prevent similar selector issues in future?

sprintObjectives: Restore complete automation functionality by fixing LinkedIn selector issues
Achieve 100% automation success rate for Start Automation button
Eliminate all selector-related errors from the automation process
Implement robust error handling and fallback mechanisms
Establish monitoring for future LinkedIn DOM changes

riskAssessment.mitigation: Immediate priority focus on automation restoration with comprehensive testing

riskAssessment.risk: All users affected by automation failure
riskAssessment.mitigation: Rapid deployment pipeline ready for immediate fix release
Dedicated frontend engineer assigned to analyze current LinkedIn page structure

riskAssessment.risk: Selector updates needed across multiple components
riskAssessment.mitigation: Systematic review of all automation-related selectors and batch updates

riskAssessment.risk: Comprehensive testing required to prevent regression
riskAssessment.mitigation: Structured testing plan covering all automation scenarios and edge cases

riskAssessment.risk: Future LinkedIn changes may break selectors again
riskAssessment.mitigation: Implement selector monitoring and more resilient DOM selection strategies

dependencies.description: Core automation functionality must be restored before any other work can proceed
